The 'Left' option gives me more money (600 vs 400), but creates a huge inequality (600 vs 0). The 'Right' option gives me less (400 vs 600), but creates equality (400 vs 400). I think about this in the framework of equality. While the money aspect is appealing, the equality and fairness of the 'Right' option are more appealing. In essence, my inclination to fairness and logic, honed by years of identifying errors in reasoning, leads me to favor the option that distributes resources more evenly. Even though it would be ideal to pick the former, I have some inclination towards equality. Therefore, I pick the 'Right' option.
